intro: Cyrtandra cyathibracteata, commonly known as the coral tree or Hawaiian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, coral-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often found in areas with well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
